channel.title: I think it was us
channel.description:
It might have been us (wrench_king and I) who crashed the server, we configured a gate wrong and it tried putting multiple books in the auto enchanter.. i just tried it in single player and yea it crashed my world
This was not intended..

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

Tom:

I already installed bukkitforge, that’s how the other plugin works. I tried a fair amount of Auth plugins before sticking with the current one, but if you can confirm one fully works (As in, doesn’t break when people start using machinery, or whatever) then we can try that. The issue with using plugins with bukkitforge is that we can’t really confirm the longevity of their usage without trying them on the live server, we just don’t have time to sit around on FTB placing every single block and doing every single action to see which one magically breaks it.

On the mindcrack pack, you were using the one I sent you right? Fihgu’s stand alone login mod + core (The beta version was out then for 1.4.6) (http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/1484373-152smpfihgus-command-mods-for-vanilla-server/) (ignore the title, read the actual topic)
When did you switch over to bukkitforge + a diff auth plugin?

currently testing
http://build.technicpack.net/job/BukkitForge/257/
http://dev.bukkit.org/bukkit-mods/authme-reloaded/files/31-auth-me-2-7-11/

^ That looks good too me

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I already installed bukkitforge, that’s how the other plugin works. I tried a fair amount of Auth plugins before sticking with the current one, but if you can confirm one fully works (As in, doesn’t break when people start using machinery, or whatever) then we can try that. The issue with using plugins with bukkitforge is that we can’t really confirm the longevity of their usage without trying them on the live server, we just don’t have time to sit around on FTB placing every single block and doing every single action to see which one magically breaks it.

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

You can use bukkitforge and mess around with AuthMe and see if it does the job. I know I got AuthMe semi-working with Bukkitforge on a ftb server I was messing around with awhile back. Tho this was an older version of bukkitforge so its worth a try with an updated version, core protect also apparently works with bukkitforge as well

http://www.bukkitforge.com/index.php

I’ll test after my exam

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:20, topic:520979”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=639487.msg4311872#msg4311872 date=1370880574]
Well I had to roll back the world to the 5th before the server would even finish loading. Now we have found out the offline authentication plugin isn’t completely compatible with all the machinery of ftb so it’s constantly spamming stack traces in the console. So the temporary solution given by Tom was just to enable online mode so at least some people could play problem is, mitb’s server doesn’t allow outgoing connections so the server can’t authenticate users.

Same situation as in my first post on the topic, lol.

I told Jamie what to do, did you get my relay? If not, let me take a crack at it, send me the world files

The world file isn’t something you can just download off the server then upload back to it, it’s too big to do that…
[/quote]
Honestly, the server is still fairly new’ish that’s why I asked. I was expecting like 300 to 400mb. But you make it seem like its 4-6 gigs[/quote]It’s 6Gb. Anyway I’m out of ideas. Also mitb is the only one capable of doing the firewall/connection settings to allow it connection to the minecraft user authentication server. Also the 6Gb is the entire world folder I know the individual dimension is smaller but it’s still 1Gb.

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:19, topic:520979”]Well I had to roll back the world to the 5th before the server would even finish loading. Now we have found out the offline authentication plugin isn’t completely compatible with all the machinery of ftb so it’s constantly spamming stack traces in the console. So the temporary solution given by Tom was just to enable online mode so at least some people could play problem is, mitb’s server doesn’t allow outgoing connections so the server can’t authenticate users.

Same situation as in my first post on the topic, lol.

I told Jamie what to do, did you get my relay? If not, let me take a crack at it, send me the world files

The world file isn’t something you can just download off the server then upload back to it, it’s too big to do that…[/quote]
Honestly, the server is still fairly new’ish that’s why I asked. I was expecting like 300 to 400mb. But you make it seem like its 4-6 gigs

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Well I had to roll back the world to the 5th before the server would even finish loading. Now we have found out the offline authentication plugin isn’t completely compatible with all the machinery of ftb so it’s constantly spamming stack traces in the console. So the temporary solution given by Tom was just to enable online mode so at least some people could play problem is, mitb’s server doesn’t allow outgoing connections so the server can’t authenticate users.

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:14, topic:520979”][quote author=Tom link=topic=639487.msg4311652#msg4311652 date=1370834858]
Same situation as in my first post on the topic, lol.
[/quote]
I told Jamie what to do, did you get my relay? If not, let me take a crack at it, send me the world files[/quote]

The world file isn’t something you can just download off the server then upload back to it, it’s too big to do that…

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:6, topic:520979”]A fix for it would be to start the server without MFR enabled, and enable it again. Thats why I want to know his coordinates, so we only need to load his region and not mess up with other players MFR stuff.

badger41 and xylo: I assume you were were at the place of the block? Then it is also possible to go into the player file and find your location (very easy), copy the region you were, and make a new region folder with only that region, then start the server without MFR. That should remove it from the game and fix the server.

Tom: What do you think can solve this issue?[/quote]

yes we were standing <5 blocks from it

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

A fix for it would be to start the server without MFR enabled, and enable it again. Thats why I want to know his coordinates, so we only need to load his region and not mess up with other players MFR stuff.

badger41 and xylo: I assume you were were at the place of the block? Then it is also possible to go into the player file and find your location (very easy), copy the region you were, and make a new region folder with only that region, then start the server without MFR. That should remove it from the game and fix the server.

Tom: What do you think can solve this issue?

Read full topic

item.title: I think it was us
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I’m having some connectivity issues at the moment, I’m going to keep retrying, and passing them onto MITB. Right now I can’t really do anything, but I’ve passed the issues and a recommended solution onto Zuppers. If it sorts itself out I’ll deal with it, if not you’ll either have to wait for it or wait for Zuppers.

Read full topic
